titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Edward Armin Schumann (1879-1970) was a Philadelphia gynecologist. Schumann received his M.D. from the University of Pennsylvania in 1901, and practiced obstetrics and gynecology in Philadelphia until his death. Schumann was Pathologist at the Gynecean Hospital, Gynecologist at Philadelphia General Hospital, Obstetrician at Chestnut Hill Hospital, and Surgeon-in-Chief at the Kensington Hospital for Women, 1931-1944. In 1929, he joined the faculty of the University of Pennsylvania and was appointed Professor of Obstetrics in 1933. Schumann was a president of the American Gynecological Society and Fellow of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Edward A. Schumann. Materials include typescripts, manuscripts, and reprints of addresses and articles on a range of obstetrical and more general medical topics. Also included in the collection are portraits of W.H. Goeckerman, Joseph Brettauer, George Henry Fox, and George Gellhorn. There is also a sketch by James McBey of a dinner meeting of the American Gynecological Association officers, several photographs of Schumann lecturing to medical students in the late 1930s, and three opium tax stamps.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: College of Physicians of Philadelphia: Edward Schumann papers (MSS 2/0205-01).
